page.title: 11HYDROPATHY
page.content: Matlock has many large{Victorian {buildings}on the hillside.These were{ {hydropathic establishments}.People with illnesses came to stay at the hydros where they had different kinds of baths in the hope that these would cure them. After the first and second World Wars the hydros went out of fashion, and, today, the large buildings are used for other purposes.The College of Higher Education uses several as halls of residence and lecture rooms.Others have become schools and hotels and the most famous, Smedley's Hydro, has become the County Offices.
